auto_merge.commit_message:
Fixes issue on mac where it was constantly reloading buffers as paths
were not being normalized and resolved correctly (in relation to buffer
name).

Quickfix entry:
/var/folders/pt/2s7dzyw12v36tsslrghfgpkr0000gn/T/git-difftool.m95lj8/right/app.vue

Buffer name:
/private/var/folders/pt/2s7dzyw12v36tsslrghfgpkr0000gn/T/git-difftool.m95lj8/right/app.vue

/var was synlinked to /private/var and this was not being properly
handled.

Also added lazy redraw to avoid too many redraws when this happens in
future and added test for symlink handling.

Signed-off-by: Tomas Slusny <slusnucky@gmail.com>
auto_merge.commit_title: fix(difftool): fully resolve symlinks when comparing paths #36147

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Fixes issue on mac where it was constantly reloading buffers as paths
were not being normalized and resolved correctly (in relation to buffer
name).

Quickfix entry:
/var/folders/pt/2s7dzyw12v36tsslrghfgpkr0000gn/T/git-difftool.m95lj8/right/app.vue

Buffer name:
/private/var/folders/pt/2s7dzyw12v36tsslrghfgpkr0000gn/T/git-difftool.m95lj8/right/app.vue

/var was synlinked to /private/var and this was not being properly
handled.

Also added lazy redraw to avoid too many redraws when this happens in
future and added test for symlink handling.

See relevant reddit debugging "session": https://www.reddit.com/r/neovim/comments/1o4eo6s/new_difftool_command_added_to_neovim/nj270sw/

comment_data.body: use `('..'):format()`, not `..`. though this looks like a case for `vim.fs.joinpath`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -61,6 +61,34 @@ describe('nvim.difftool', function()
     )
   end)
 
+  it('handles symlinks correctly', function()
+    if jit and jit.os == 'Windows' then
+      pending('Symlink test skipped on Windows')
+      return
+    end
+
+    -- Create a symlink in right dir pointing to file2.txt in left dir
+    local symlink_path = testdir_right .. pathsep .. 'file2.txt'

@@ -61,6 +61,34 @@ describe('nvim.difftool', function()
     )
   end)
 
+  it('handles symlinks correctly', function()
+    if jit and jit.os == 'Windows' then
+      pending('Symlink test skipped on Windows')
+      return
+    end
+
+    -- Create a symlink in right dir pointing to file2.txt in left dir
+    local symlink_path = testdir_right .. pathsep .. 'file2.txt'
+    local target_path = '../' .. testdir_left .. pathsep .. 'file2.txt'
+    assert(os.execute(('ln -s %s %s'):format(target_path, symlink_path)) == 0)
+
+    -- Run difftool
+    command(('DiffTool %s %s'):format(testdir_left, testdir_right))
+    local qflist = fn.getqflist()
+    local entries = {}
+    for _, item in ipairs(qflist) do
+      table.insert(entries, { text = item.text, rel = item.user_data and item.user_data.rel })
+    end
+
+    -- file2.txt should not be reported as added or deleted anymore
+    eq({
+      { text = 'M', rel = 'file1.txt' },
+      { text = 'A', rel = 'file3.txt' },
+    }, entries)
+
+    pcall(os.remove, symlink_path)

@@ -61,6 +61,34 @@ describe('nvim.difftool', function()
     )
   end)
 
+  it('handles symlinks correctly', function()
+    if jit and jit.os == 'Windows' then
+      pending('Symlink test skipped on Windows')
+      return
+    end
+
+    -- Create a symlink in right dir pointing to file2.txt in left dir
+    local symlink_path = testdir_right .. pathsep .. 'file2.txt'
+    local target_path = '../' .. testdir_left .. pathsep .. 'file2.txt'
+    assert(os.execute(('ln -s %s %s'):format(target_path, symlink_path)) == 0)

@@ -140,14 +140,16 @@ local function diff_dirs_diffr(left_dir, right_dir, opt)
       elseif right_exists then
         status = 'A'
       end
+      local left = vim.fn.resolve(vim.fs.abspath(modified_left))
+      local right = vim.fn.resolve(vim.fs.abspath(modified_right))

         status = 'A'

comment_regular_data.body: vim.uv.fs_realpath is returning nil for me for some reason hm
So the user that reported the issue also had nil returns thats why it "solved" it but it did not solved the real issue, so still debugging. I dont have mac to reproduce tho so its hard.

For context from the reddit debugging, the original PR was with vim.uv.fs_realpath, but in the end vim.fn.resolve ended up fixing the issue, this is the entry submitted from user:

Quickfix entry:
/var/folders/pt/2s7dzyw12v36tsslrghfgpkr0000gn/T/git-difftool.m95lj8/right/app.vue

Buffer name:
/private/var/folders/pt/2s7dzyw12v36tsslrghfgpkr0000gn/T/git-difftool.m95lj8/right/app.vue

looks like macos symlinks /var to /private/var . And normally `right` is also symlink to actual user git directory (at least on linux, maybe on mac too), so the issue was all symlinks werent properly resolved. I even used vim.fn.resolve for built-in diff before as well, but did not used it for the `diffr` implementation. So now its consistent and the paths should always be fully resolved and fully comparable.

title: fix(difftool): fully resolve symlinks when comparing paths
